title: Evaporative Canister - Installation

body.body: Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
Before disconnecting any fuel lines, make sure the engine and exhaust system has cooled down.
Failure to follow the advice above could risk a fire, which could result in serious injury or death.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Notice - Transition Pieces, Map/ Evap Hoses - DO NOT Use Lubricants When Fitting
Never use lubricants when you fit throttle bodies onto transition pieces, or evaporative (EVAP) hoses or Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) hoses onto spigots.
When dried, the lubricant may block the spigots and restrictors.
A blocked spigot or restrictor will cause the engine to operate inefficiently, and a DTC (Diagnostic Trouble Code) to be recorded.
If required, route the drain hose as noted during removal.
Make sure the purge valve hose is routed as noted during removal.
Connect the purge valve and fuel tank hose
Connect the breather and drain hoses to the evaporative canister.
Position the evaporative canister onto the frame brackets.
Make sure that the joins in the cable ties are positioned on the bottom of the evaporative canister.
Install two new cable ties to attach the evaporative canister to the frame.

search: Evaporative Canister - Installation
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
Before disconnecting any fuel lines, make sure the engine and exhaust system has cooled down.
Failure to follow the advice above could risk a fire, which could result in serious injury or death.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Never use lubricants when you fit throttle bodies onto transition pieces, or evaporative (EVAP) hoses or Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) hoses onto spigots.
When dried, the lubricant may block the spigots and restrictors.
A blocked spigot or restrictor will cause the engine to operate inefficiently, and a DTC (Diagnostic Trouble Code) to be recorded.
If required, route the drain hose as noted during removal.
Make sure the purge valve hose is routed as noted during removal.
Connect the purge valve and fuel tank hose
Connect the breather and drain hoses to the evaporative canister.
Evaporative canister
Breather hose (8.5 mm bore)
Drain hose (4 mm bore)
Cable ties
Fuel tank hose (3.5 mm bore)
Purge valve hose (8 mm bore)
Position the evaporative canister onto the frame brackets.
Make sure that the joins in the cable ties are positioned on the bottom of the evaporative canister.
Install two new cable ties to attach the evaporative canister to the frame.
Perform the following operations:
Fuel Tank - Installation
Outrigger Cover Panels - Installation
Battery - Installation
Seat - Installation
